info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 24 at 10:47AM MST until December 25 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches from Bad Rock Canyon to Essex, with 8 to 16 inches from Essex to Marias Pass. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches for Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake. * WHERE...Bad Rock Canyon, Essex, Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake, Marias Pass, and Polebridge. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Watch, from this afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. A period of heavier snowfall will begin late this evening and will continue into Saturday morning. Blowing and drifting of snow is possible from Essex to Marias Pass.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
